channel.title: After Packaging My Delta Source
channel.description:
I packaged my delta server in accordance to [url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,539427.msg3947963.html#msg3947963]https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,539427.msg3947963.html#msg3947963[/url]. After compiling and wrestling with my compiler, I received this [url=http://gyazo.com/d70d4eefdd35ed2c3f958c0b2c5c2aa9]http://gyazo.com/d70d4eefdd35ed2c3f958c0b2c5c2aa9[/url] Here are my results.[url=http://gyazo.com/b14480586856c48e6b9a5d3c738c01c3]http://gyazo.com/b14480586856c48e6b9a5d3c738c01c3[/url] I run my client and it loads. Which brings me to the the attached picture below. No idea how this is happening but some help would be nice. my Team-viewer I.D. is 553 593 206. That is if anyone is willing to help.
Edit.. I tried to login twice and both times i got error connecting to server.

item.dc:creator: @wodkode wodkode
item.description:

can you please just use an IDE and save everyone (including yourself) the stress

You must think i use the notepad.

item.title: After Packaging My Delta Source
item.dc:creator: @wodkode wodkode
item.description:
@wodkode wrote:

before

@echo off "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_55\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

after

@echo off "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_55\bin\javac.exe" -d ./bin ./src/ss/*.java ./src/ss/entity/*.java ./src/ss/handlers/entity/*.java ./src/ss/handlers/player/*.java ./src/ss/handlers/world/*.java ./src/ss/items/*.java ./src/ss/player/*.java ./src/ss/world/*.java pause

Dont mind the code tags, i got bored.
it take about 20 secs for the error to appear.

THIS^^^
i went in and changed to thiscode=html5[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: After Packaging My Delta Source
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

Perhaps a silent error is thrown in one of the file reads? things like (EX. “/log/trades.txt” FileNotFound)

If the directory is read-only, your “run” method throws an IOException if the file could not be created. Make sure files are not hidden as well.

Does it instantly tell you “error connecting to server” or does it take a while for that to appear?

Can you show us your compiler before&after?

Read full topic

item.title: After Packaging My Delta Source
item.dc:creator: @wodkode wodkode
item.description:
@wodkode wrote:

@echo off "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_55\bin\javac.exe" -d ./bin ./src/null/*.java ./src/null/entity/*.java ./src/null/handlers/entity/*.java ./src/null/handlers/player/*.java ./src/null/handlers/world/*.java ./src/null/items/*.java ./src/null/player/*.java ./src/null/world/*.java pause
I can confirm this works.
I have a back up of my source non-packaged and it works.

Read full topic

item.title: After Packaging My Delta Source
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:6, topic:552551”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671468.msg4490512#msg4490512 date=1437520370]

when wrestling with your compiler, did you by chance bypass your compiling? How long did “press any key to continue” take to appear? If it had a decent delay on it, you are still compiling.

The second it says “Press any key to continue” is the second you’re done compiling.

Looking at the server console, I’m wondering why you’re logging in from two different ports within the same login attempt? Should the port not be static?
[/quote]

@echo off pause
Output:

Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]

No shit sherlock holmes.
Now add in the Java compiler args. It won’t display “Press any key to continue . . .” until the compiler has finished executing.

Read full topic

Looking at the server console, I’m wondering why you’re logging in from two different ports within the same login attempt? Should the port not be static?[/quote]

Press any key to continue . . .
